example.eg: Out of 650 votes, there were only three against the motion.
example.egtrans: 该提案的650张投票里，只有三张反对票。

example.eg: Many Americans are against the war.
example.egtrans: 许多美国人反对打这场战争。

example.eg: My team is playing against the national champions.
example.egtrans: 我的队伍正在和全国冠军打比赛。

example.eg: Mark's errors counted against him in the final scoring.
example.egtrans: 马克的失误不利于他最后的得分。

example.eg: The army exists to protect against invasion.
example.egtrans: 这支军队的存在是为了抵御外敌入侵。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 反抗，对抗, 防御，抵御

example.eg: I have been awarded six thousand pounds against the loss I suffered.
example.egtrans: 我获得了6000镑的损失补偿。

example.eg: The buildings looked small against the mountains behind them.
example.egtrans: 和它们背后的群山相比，这些建筑显得很小。

example.eg: Lean the ladder against the wall when you're not using it.
example.egtrans: 不用梯子时，请把它靠在墙上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 靠着, 倚在, 贴着

example.eg: The work is behind schedule because we came up against some unexpected problems.
example.egtrans: 我们遇到了一些意想不到的问题，因此工作延期了。

example.eg: Davies will come up against last year's champion in the semi-final of the competition.
example.egtrans: 戴维斯将在大赛的半决赛中对阵去年的冠军。

example.eg: If you go against his wishes, he will make things difficult for you.
To go against the mob takes courage.
Wear a sunhat to guard against sunburn.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保护，保卫, 防御，防卫

example.eg: They still hold my past mistakes against me.
The remote mountain village held out against the foreign armies.
example.egtrans: 这偏远的山村顶住了外国军队的进攻。//我坚决不加入Facebook。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 持续抵抗, 持续抵制

example.eg: Jesse has always had a tendency to kick against authority.
She bottles up her anger towards her mother and then lashes out against her husband for no reason.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 猛然怒斥, 严厉斥责

example.eg: The protesters went to Washington to march against increased taxes.
Every time I play against Tom, he beats me in every game.
I'd advise against that course of action.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 忠告, 建议（某人不要…）

example.eg: I'd advise against travelling alone in the desert.
I'd advise you against that approach, which can be costly.
I'd advise you against sailing today; the weather is turning nasty.
Julie fell out of the moving train.  She survived against all odds.

dsense.name: against his will, against her will

example.eg: Abby was taken to the cabin in the woods against her will.
It's seems as though I am always working against the clock!  These deadlines are ridiculous.
Smoking marijuana is against the law.
He was driving against the law as he had just guzzled down seven pints of beer.
Residents are in a race against time as flood waters begin to crest along the river.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抢时间的, 争分夺秒的

example.eg: They're racing against time to find a cure for her illness.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抢时间地, 争分夺秒地

example.eg: Mindy balanced her long hours at work with a visit to the spa.
example.egtrans: 明迪用做水疗来平衡长时间工作。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用…平衡…，用…来补偿…, 用…来抵消…

example.eg: He battled in vain against the factory closures.
Ed Miliband battled against his brother David for leadership of the Labour party.
Fred bore a grudge against his brothers.
Julie bears a grudge against her neighbour for cutting down a hedge that was actually on Julie's property.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 因某事对某人怀恨在心

example.eg: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 作假见证陷害（某人），说谎陷害（某人）

example.eg: A wife cannot be forced to bear witness against her husband.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为...作证, 做...的目击证人

example.eg: The state's department of education benchmarks their salary scale against those of other government agencies.
example.egtrans: 该州教育部门把其他政府机构的薪级表作为评价他们薪级表的基准。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 定标, 以...作为...评价基准

example.eg: Oscar lost his money because he bet against the winning horse.
example.egtrans: 因为奥斯卡打赌不会赢的马是冠军，所以他输了钱。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 打赌...不会赢, 下注...会输

example.eg: I wouldn't bet against his getting the promotion.
example.egtrans: 我敢打赌他一定会升职。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 打赌...不会发生, 断定...会失败

example.eg: The manager was fired because of his bias against women.
example.egtrans: 因为对女性的偏见，那个经理被开除了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对…的偏见, 对…的成见, 对…的歧视

example.eg: The media may have biased people against voting for Taylor.
example.egtrans: 媒体可能让人们产生了偏见，导致人们未将选票投给泰勒。

example.eg: She brought a lawsuit against her employer.
I brushed up against him just as he was leaving.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 轻触, 擦碰, 触碰

example.eg: Congress bucked against the president's proposal.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坚决反对, 坚持拒绝

example.eg: The decorative moulding butts up against the door.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 边缘与...相接, 与...前后接连

example.eg: The Abolitionists were campaigning against the slave trade.
example.egtrans: 废奴主义者开展了反对奴隶贸易的运动。

example.eg: The doctor cautioned against eating too many sweets.
Shannon checked her calendar against her boss's to see if there were any conflicts.
Edwards will be competing against some of the best athletes in the world.
example.egtrans: 爱德华兹将要与那些全世界最优秀的运动员对抗。

example.eg: His criminal record will count against him when he starts applying for jobs.
Waves crashed against the shore.
example.egtrans: 波涛猛力拍打着海岸。

example.eg: Genocide is a crime against humanity.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 危害人类罪, 反人性罪

example.eg: She's always crusading against injustice, wherever she finds it.
Janet dashed the plate against the wall.
example.egtrans: 珍妮特把盘子向墙猛扔过去。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把...猛掷在...上, 把...向...猛扔去

example.eg: Waves dashed against the shore.
example.egtrans: 波涛撞击海岸。

example.eg: I wanted to go to Art School, but my parents were dead against it.
Jerry was dead set against the Prime Minister's proposal.
Sarah decided against a third cupcake as she was full.
example.egtrans: 因为萨拉已经吃饱了，所以她决定拒绝第三块小蛋糕。

example.eg: I decided against going on holiday this year, since I had just lost my job.
example.egtrans: 由于我才丢了工作，所以我决定今年不去度假了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 决定不做, 选择不做

dsense.name: declare war on [sb/sth], declare war against [sb/sth]

example.eg: France declared war on Prussia on July 19, 1870.  On July 28th 1914 Austria-Hungary declared war against Serbia.
example.egtrans: 法国在1870年7月19日向普鲁士王国宣战。1914年7月28日，奥匈帝国向塞尔维亚宣战。

example.eg: Medieval castles had moats, drawbridges and other structures to defend against attack.
Lisa defended her friend against the bully.
Protesters are demonstrating against the government.
example.egtrans: 游行者向政府示威。

example.eg: It is illegal to discriminate against someone because of his or her age.
He fought against the new regulations.
example.egtrans: 他与新的规定作斗争。

example.eg: The jury found against the defendants, who were ordered to pay millions of dollars in damages.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 作出（不利的）判决，作出对…不利的宣判
强烈斥责, 严厉谴责, 愤怒驳斥
违反常理, 不合常规

example.eg: Your acting dishonestly certainly goes against the grain.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 违反个人的本性, 违反自己的原则

example.eg: The travel agent had warned Beth to guard against pickpockets when she traveled abroad.
example.egtrans: 那位旅游代理警告贝丝，要她出国旅游的时候小心扒手。

example.eg: They have a bias against assertive women.
Peter holds a grudge against his co-worker, who received the promotion that Peter was hoping for.

dsense.name: hold it against [sb]
dsense.guideword: informal (bear a grudge) (因过去之事而)

example.eg: She insulted him years ago, and he still holds it against her.
I won't hold it against you if you don't want to join me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 因某事而对某人有怨气

example.eg: We are hoping against hope that one day he'll come home to us.

dsense.name: immunize [sb] against [sth], also UK: immunise [sb] against [sth]

example.eg: Children in the U.S. are all immunized against polio.
This policy will indemnify you against all loss in case of fires, floods, or theft.
example.egtrans: 该保单将就火灾、洪水或偷盗情况下的所有损失向你赔偿。

example.eg: The priest inveighed against premarital sex.
example.egtrans: 牧师猛烈抨击了婚前性行为。

example.eg: We must continue to labor against this discrimination.
He felt dizzy and had to lean against the wall for support.
The thief leaned his ladder against the wall of the house.
The board is leaning against the wall.
The new president's success would always be measured against his predecessor's.
example.egtrans: 人们总是会把新任总统的成功和前任总统相比较。

example.eg: He tested his skill to see how he measures against the competition.
example.egtrans: 他考验了自己的技能，比较与竞争对手的实力。

example.eg: The baby bird nestled against his mother.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 依偎, 安顿, 安顿

example.eg: Ben nestled his chin against his girlfriend's shoulder.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将头脸或肩膀等贴靠在

example.eg: The little boy nuzzled against his mother's neck.
You can offset any loss you make in a year against your profits.
example.egtrans: 你可以使你一年所造成的损失和利润相互抵消。

example.eg: This match pits the titleholder against a complete unknown.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使...相竞争, 使...对立, 使...相较量

example.eg: We should distinguish between prejudice against people and active discrimination.
example.egtrans: 我们应当将对人们的偏见和主动歧视区分开来。

example.eg: The influence of the extreme right wing has prejudiced the party's more moderate elements against ethnic minorities.
example.egtrans: 极右势力的影响使党派中较为持中的分子也产生了不利于少数民族的偏见。

example.eg: The negative reports have prejudiced public opinion against the actor.
example.egtrans: 这些负面报道使公众舆论对该演员产生了偏见。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…对…产生偏见, 使…对…带有偏见
